services.title: Our Medical Services
services.subtitle: We offer a variety of healthcare services tailored to meet your needs.

physiotherapy.title: Physiotherapy Rehab
physiotherapy.text: Physiotherapy focuses on restoring movement, strength, and function after injury, surgery, or long-term pain conditions. Treatment plans are personalised and may include exercises, manual techniques, and movement re-education to help you return safely to daily activities.

osteopathy.title: Osteopathy Treatment
osteopathy.text: Osteopathy takes a holistic approach, treating the body as a connected system. Using gentle hands-on techniques, osteopathy helps improve joint mobility, muscle balance, circulation, and overall body function, supporting natural healing.

manual.title: Manual Therapy
manual.text: Manual therapy involves specialised hands-on techniques such as joint mobilisation, soft tissue release, and stretching. It helps reduce pain, improve flexibility, and restore normal movement, especially in the spine and joints.

sports.title: Sports Injury Treatment
sports.text: This service focuses on diagnosing, treating, and preventing injuries related to physical activity and sports. Treatment helps athletes recover faster, improve performance, and reduce the risk of future injuries through targeted rehabilitation.

posture.title: Postural Assessment & Correction
posture.text: Postural assessment identifies imbalances caused by prolonged sitting, poor movement habits, or work-related strain. Corrective exercises and manual treatment help improve posture, reduce pain, and prevent long-term musculoskeletal problems.

chronic.title: Chronic Pain Management
chronic.text: Chronic pain treatment aims to reduce long-term discomfort and improve quality of life. A combination of manual therapy, exercise, and education is used to manage pain conditions safely and effectively.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get Every Single Answer There if You Want
faq.q1: What conditions can physiotherapy help with?
faq.a1: Physiotherapy can help with back and neck pain, joint pain, muscle injuries, post-surgery rehabilitation, mobility problems, sports injuries, posture issues, and chronic pain conditions.
faq.q2: How long does a physiotherapy session typically last?
faq.a2: A standard physiotherapy session usually lasts 30–45 minutes, depending on your condition and treatment plan. Your therapist will assess your needs and decide the appropriate duration.
faq.q3: What is osteopathy, and how is it different from physiotherapy?
faq.a3: Osteopathy focuses on the body as a whole, using gentle manual techniques to improve joint mobility, muscle balance, and overall body function. Physiotherapy is more exercise- and rehabilitation-based. Both work well together, and your therapist may combine techniques for the best results.
faq.a4: Manual therapy techniques are usually gentle and should not cause significant pain. You may feel mild pressure or stretching, but it should always feel comfortable. If anything feels too intense, your therapist will adjust the technique immediately.
